meanings.definition: A situation or condition in which there is no movement or activity
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the town experienced standstills as everyone stayed indoors.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam caused long standstills on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The standstills in the library were so quiet that you could hear a pin drop.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of spiders led to mental standstills whenever she saw one.
meanings.sent5: The standstills in the waiting room made time feel like it had stopped.

meanings.definition: A temporary stop or halt in progress or movement
meanings.sent1: The sudden power outage resulted in standstills in the factory production.
meanings.sent2: The construction work had to pause due to unexpected standstills in the supply chain.
meanings.sent3: The standstills in the marathon caused confusion among the runners.
meanings.sent4: His heartache brought emotional standstills to his daily routine.
meanings.sent5: The standstills in the dance performance added suspense to the audience's experience.
